text: Amazon EFS is a cloud native datastore
that provides simple scalable elastic
shared file storage for Linux based
business applications it can grow to
petabytes while delivering consistent
low legacies and high levels of
throughput and it's fully managed so you
don't have to worry about ongoing
maintenance Amazon EFS is easy to setup
simply use the AWS management console
API or command line interface to create
a file system and make it available to
one or more Amazon V pcs your ec2
instances can securely then mount your
filesystem
to store and access data you can also
mount on-premises servers to EFS using
AWS direct connect or AWS VPN making it
easy to migrate data to EFS enable cloud
bursting or backup your on-premises data
to EFS ZFS file systems are elastic and
automatically grow and shrink as you add
and remove files you can choose between
two performance modes so that you can
tailor your file system performance to
your application needs throughput for a
file system scales automatically as
capacity grows for workloads with high
throughput requirements and low capacity
needs throughput can be provisioned
independent of capacity for less
frequently accessed data you can
configure EFS to store data in a cost
optimized infrequent access storage
class Amazon EFS works with the tools
and applications you already use it is
designed for high availability and
durability storing your data redundantly
across multiple availability zones with
EFS you always have the capacity you
need when you need it without having to
provision storage in advance pay for
only what you use with no minimum fees
or setup costs it eliminates storage
administration tasks so you can focus on
more crucial business to get started
visit aws.amazon.com DFS and create your
first file system in just a few clicks
[Music]
